intro: Trichoscypha abut, commonly known as the African sand dollar tree, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by woody, spherical fruits containing numerous seeds. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry and semi-arid environments. Trichoscypha abut is valued for its ornamental appeal and has some traditional uses in local communities.
